NOt bad at all, you weren't even gonna fill us in on such great gems replacing all the things taken away from the wharf. hmm... gotta tell ya I love it. 
This place was amazing. You can actually touch the figures and post with them. 
I had alot of fun. I hope for more from this place . I am pretty sure I'll be back and thats one thing I couldn't say about the other wax museum.  I love this place.
author: Luke S.

description:
I've been to other Madame Tussauds locations in the past, and this one in  San Francisco is fairly new and replaces the previous Wax Museum.

You can actually get up close to these wax figures and have lots of fun. Very interactive exhibits, though the museum itself seems smaller than these other locations. Prices are pretty steep however, but sometimes their website offers discounted tickets if you order online. There are also various areas where the staff takes your photo and when you get to the exit, you first encounter this area where you can buy a souvenir album (didn't catch the prices, but agree with other Yelpers that it's too expensive and not worth it). Get as many of your own photos with your camera as you can!
author: Paul N.

description:
This was my first time to visit a Madame Tussaud Wax Museum after hearing about it from other people.  This may not be as big as the other museums in the world, but was still pretty amusing.

They have a figure of Santana, Jimmy Hendrix, Barack Obama, Steve Jobs, Rhianna and other celebrities.  There is a green screen where they take a picture of your and your family (if not travelling alone) and to buy this photo is optional at the end of the tour.  There are 2 elevators that lead you up to 3rd floor. Santana, Hendrix, Mayor Lee and other notable celebrities such as Bob Marley, Tony Bennett, Madonna, Beyonce, Tupac, Michael Jackson and the old (and fatter) version of Adele just to name a few.

2nd floor has Clooney, Anne Hathaway, Jennifer Aniston, Elton John. At the end of this path, you come up to 2 elevators that bring you back downstairs where you have the choice to purchase the green-screen photo of your Madam Tussaud Souvenir.  This place is also attached to the "San Francisco Dungeon" attraction which happens to be next door.  If you want to be more thrilled and entertained, go next door and try that one too.  Overall, not bad for a first time trip to the museum with the family.  Hope to try the one in NY sometime this summer.
author: Bread S.

description: This place was fun! I came here with my boyfriend yesterday and it was creepy at first but the idea that it might be an actual person goes away after realizing how awesome everything is. I wish there were more wax figures there but overall it was fun to see.
author: Shannon C.

description: We had fun at this museum mostly because it's self guided and you can touch the actual figures. The props were fun and interactive. Wish they had some more figures didn't seem like it was enough. Still great and fun for families.
author: Cindy S.

description:
A way to spend a great hour taking photos and posing with freaky, life like wax figures!
Great scenes ad to the settings surrounding each figure. Well kept indeed!

I just wish it was a bit longer!
author: Jean W.

description:
We had a good time here.
The setup and ability to take pictures was good.
Little pricey for just a wax museum but I have been to a few and this place is much better than the others.  The staff throughout the museum are friendly and kind.
I think if the price was lowered they would attract more people and still be able to get the good quality.
author: Matt S.

description:
The have changed this place A LOT. I miss the horror room I cannot lie about that, but I do enjoy how interactive it is now. And the wax figures are much better quality than the ones from about 5 years ago.

Honestly what made the experience more enjoyable was the employee Ami, this review is a little late forgive me! But she was really compassionate and understanding to mine and my sisters circumstances. We came down for the day to do the San Francisco Dungeon, when we arrived (slightly buzzed) it was closed! We were so bummed that we made the trip all the way down there and our plans were completely destroyed in a second. I decided to see if it was possible to talk to someone at Madame Tussauds (since hey are affiliated) and see if we could upgrade so we could at least do the wax museum and come back another day for the dungeon. Anyways, Ami totally hooked us up and was totally sweet and understanding, which made me really, really appreciate giving her my business.

I would definitely suggest this for something fun to do if you have no plans, it's dorky but whatever!
author: Kelly A.

description: This is my second time coming to Madam Tussauds and I love her and her families work. The first one I've been to was in LA. I think I like this place better. Plus my boyfriend and I got a free ticket next door to The Dungeons
author: Angel L.

description: I came here in 2013 with my friend's and it seemed a whole lot bigger. I'm not sure if The San Francisco Dungeon took away from the museum's space or what exactly happened. I was looking forward to having my boys experience the same things I did, alas that was not the case. I left feeling kind of dissapointed. I wouldn't pay full price for admission based on the size of the place. Otherwise the wax figures looked great and the place was pretty clean.
author: Heather S.

description: Fun date location! My boyfriend and I went here one Saturday afternoon and had so much fun! I had a Groupon for $33 for 2 ppl. Sooo worth it! We loved the accessories that are placed near near all the figures, made it so fun!
author: Lauren D.

description: The way they have these wax figures set it is simply amazing! At the old wax museum I feel like they had a few older wax figures like more presidents ect but all you could do was look, with these ones it's interactive! You can pose right next. They are pretty cool and so real looking, especially whoopi goldbergs looks dead on real. I loved it. My only downfall which is why I knocked off a star (really I give 4.5 but I can't take half a star) is because the photos at the end. It feels very pressured and not comfortable due to them being printed out already I feel bad declining but I'm a local so this isn't my one and only time visiting so I wasn't as interested.
author: Katherine S.

description: I enjoyed my experience here at Madame Tussauds, i went on a day that wasn't too crowded wich made the experience even better. One major thing that i love is that a lot of the figures have props you could use to take pictures with them.
author: Devina J.

description: The staff at the front of the house were very friendly(Kiki and Kailin) and helpful to our family. Thank you guys.
author: Michael O.

description: Had a wonderful experience. Beautiful exhibitions of the wax figures. The four stars are for the customer service. We decided to buy pictures of us but noticed one of pics a little bent. We told the photography and they agreed to print another one. After our wait they gave us an additional free picture for waiting. We didn't even wait that long! We were delighted and happy. Thanks!
author: C V.

description:
This place is awesome! You can get pictures with a lot of wax figures that look so real it's creepy! I loved getting my photo taken with Audrey Hepburn, Anne Hathaway, and E.T.!

The only downside is that it's pretty short! I hope they expand it in the future. I remember the Madame Tussauds in London being much bigger!
author: Molly Q.

description:
I went here yesterday and I was astonished by the big change they made inside the wax museum. Before you were only allowed to look at them and you couldn't even take pictures. Now they all have their own settings with props to take pictures with.
What I didn't like about my experience is first of all the customer service. I don't know if the staff was just cranky since its 4th of July weekend/the elevator not working, but oh man they were rude to me. Second of all they took out a lot of the old wax figures that used to have. I think they need to add more of a variety in there and more current stars.
I also think some wax figures don't even look like the stars. For example the wax Laverne Cox and Beyoncé don't look like the real ones. Lastly the prices are way too high and they got rid of the resident/student discount. I wouldn't come here again due to it not being that great.
author: Sharon G.

description: Had fun taking pics with the wax figures! Wish there were many more! But overall like the set up , I havent been here for  over 5 years and they definitely made it much better!
author: Dulce G.

description: This was much more fun than we anticipated! We honestly didn't know what to expect, but genuinely enjoyed the goofing around, selfies, and awe of the amount of work put into these figures. If you are "local" (part of the nine Bay Area counties) you can get significantly discounted tickets, just ask and show your ID!! They have other discounts for military, too, I believe.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Our family took a day trip to the city. First we went to the California Academy of Science, very cool, then down to Pier 39 to eat, then to top it off we went to hang out with some great people. 

There were only a couple of bummers tho. 
1.) No Michael Myers - for my wife
2.) 5th Harmony - for our daughter
... they were on tour... D'oh!

But seriously, the art they create here is a must see!!!
author: David E.

description: Normally I would have never gone to this but we had a pass and this was included. It was so fun. The weather was cloudy and th I s was a oerfect silly activity.
author: Kristin K.

description:
The owners were really cool. We had a lot of fun. I wish there was a good place to park near fisherman's wharf. I also should have read these reviews before buying a groupon! Wish I could have gotten a dungeon admission for free. 

Ah well. I'd go back to this place, we really did enjoy it. If anyone knows of a good place to park feel free to message me! We paid $35 or something for the afternoon :(

Oh, and I wish the professional photos they took weren't so expensive. $15 each or $35 for all, but I guess they have to make $$ somehow!
author: Emma M.

description: Kiki was so helpful in getting us a great deal with our tickets. Also the museum is so much fun and filled with real life characters. Plus when we went it wasn't super busy. I totally recommend this when looking for something fun to do on your day off or vacation.
author: Stormy B.

description: Overall this place is pretty fun. But as others recommend look around for the best price. The lady at the door told us $60 for four and then at the register they tried to charge us full price..no way would I pay $100 plus to get in this place that's Way over priced. In the end we only paid the $60 and we had a good time.
author: Sirena L.

description: Honestly, I was shocked how great of an experience it was! I was really sad when this place came along to replace the original SF wax museum. It was one of my favorite tourist spots. The wax figurines looked great and I loved how interactive it was and how you could touch the figurines and someone takes your pictures with them for a fee of course. Great spot
author: Heather S.

description:
I had such a great time here! The set up was fantastic - you were able to take as many pictures with the wax figures as you wanted and there were even props! 

My only reservation is that it is a bit pricey for one person but there is an option to buy tickets online and save.

I had never been to a wax museum before so I expected that the figures were to be looked at and not touched so when first seeing that the price was $26 per person I thought it was overpriced. I ended up going because I received free admission when I got tickets for the SF Dungeon. I would definitely recommend going if you're willing to pay $26 per person. Great entertainment for a group of friends :)
author: Rachel M.

description: I live an hr south of SF in Santa Clara and one weekend, my bf and I decided to do touristy stuff in the city. We purchased a Go Card (Which I highly reccomend for tourists who plans on visiting several tourist spots) which lets you enter several bay area attractions. Out of all the tours, I really didn't enjoy the wax museum that much. I mean it's okay but not amazing compared to other attractions like California Academy of Sciences. It's a hit and miss with the personalities and celebrity wax figures. I mean come on, Zendaya is not relevant. I wouldn't pay full price for it but since it came with my Go Card, it was ayt. I did enjoy Neil Patrick Harris, Obama, Beyonce to name a few. Oh and it was way warm inside btw.
author: Angel Y.

description: This place was pretty cool. The celebrity's look so real. Steph Curry even had facial stubble that looked so real. It was fun to take pictures next to all the figures. I visited with my friend we had a good time. Only thing is it is pricey i think $35 for entrance fee. We got a san Francisco GO card which was good for 27 attractions so i would suggest getting one of those to save money.
author: Audrey N.

description: was okay but deff would not b worth the 35.00. But some of the peopld they had in there i didnt get like Laverne  Coxs really? And the girl ftom Disney  i frgt  her name  that was just strange but deff good to take pictures.  Deff better to get the go card
author: Stephany J.

description:
I would have never gone here if it weren't for the joint ticket with the Dungeon. I would not pay to come here as I don't think it's worth the price they want but that being said, we had a blast especially being free. 
I loved how we could pose with the statues and touch them. They had some great ones too, especially for the Bay Area. The props they had were a nice touch too. Wish they would have had more as it was pretty small. Got some great pics tho!!
author: Laura R.

description: Worth every penny!! Bring your camera and be creative with your poses!! If you simply stand by the wax figures and smile the pics are boring. Use the ambiance to fashion a memorable photo shoot!! Love this place!
author: From C.

description: Luckily I got my tickets through Groupon because I find the full priced tickets quite steep. I did enjoy this wax museum and some of the figures looked so realistic, it was creepy. I loved that there were costumes and props available to use for taking pictures with the wax figures and there are workers to take pics, too. If you plan on visiting the San Francisco Dungeon (next door) as well, I suggest you go to the dungeon first, then buy your wax museum tickets at the dungeon. I was offered the chance to buy wax museum tickets for only $10 each.
author: Mama Q.

description:
Madame Tussaud's is a recognized name.  I've visited the museum in Vegas and enjoyed it.  So, with some happy expectations I ventured into the new Madame Tussaud's that replaced the old San Francisco Wax Museum.  I was impressed with the wax works.  Some of them were downright creepy in their realism.  I was a little disappointed at the number of waxworks though.  It seemed like that old museum had a lot more on display.  The new museum does have a lot of nice new interactive displays.  I wish they had kept some of the older waxworks around.  Robin Williams is a San Francisco icon that deserves a spot.  It also would've been nice to see some of the scientists and historical figures that the old museum had.  Overall it is a good time.  Especially if you're bringing friends or people who have been to San Francisco before.

P.S. - What the hell is up with these arranged photo booths they have in these attractions???  I don't want to purchase a photo from them.  I don't want them to take my photo.  I tell them NO and keep walking and they keep after me and my group with questions of "how will we remember the experience" and "it's all part of the fun".  Please...
author: Nick M.

description:
Wow, wow and wow, very cool and tourist trap for sure.  I went to the one in Las Vegas as well, but this one we got through Groupon 2 for $31 dollars and definitely worth the money.  I liked all of the people they had and you can touch them and make funny photos and faces with them.  They had all sorts of celebrities like Mark Zuckerberg and Steve Jobs.  I wish they had Bill Gates. They also had a lot of people local from here like Clint Eastwood.  They had an assortment of celebrities which was nice and athletes too like Tiger Woods and Joe Montana and can not believe they had Jeremy Line. I wish they had other S.F. players like Jerry Rice or Jim Harbaugh that would have been very nice.  E.T. was pretty cool.  I wish though they had more employees take pictures as a group.  They do have particular stands where you can share the memories and get a booklet. The booklet though is overpriced however $35 dollars :(  
But overall I had a fun and exciting time.
author: Keven W.

description:
My husband and I are less than an hour outside of SF, but we decided to do a tourist day and got a three-pack of tickets (what a great deal! The Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, and Ripley's? Nice) 

I had never been in, but I was impressed with the details and the fun, silly, interactive components. I don't know that I'd go a second time anytime soon, but it's a fun thing to do on a day in SF in-between meals.
author: Amber G.

description: Yes, it's Fisherman's Wharf, and yes, it's touristy, but what can I say...we had fun. I went here today with my 9 year old daughter (who freaked out at next door's Dungeon attraction...they offered this as an alternative). I have never been to a wax museum before and my expectations were low. The staff were lovely, although your basically just walk yourself around the figures. Some of them are amazingly lifelike...I mean, REALLY. It's fun and you will take a lot of goofy pictures. The kid loved it (ET! George Washington!) and it was an entertaining way to spend 45 minutes.
author: Samantha J.

description:
My mother and I were pretty disappointed. So many of the big stars I expected to see were not at the SF location e.g. JLO, Brad, Christina Aguilera, Adam Lavine, Angelina, Britney, Deniro, Julia Roberts, Tom Cruise, any famous models, Elizabeth Taylor, Paul Newman, james Dean, Halle berry, lucille ball, Kim Kardashian  andmany more, so much so that It almost made me miss the old Wax Museum that Madam Tussaud replaced.

It sort of felt like the San Francisco museum, being one of most recent additions (locations) to the Madam Tussauds attraction, sort of inherited the bulk of unwanted, less famous and less interesting  and attractive figures. Hopefully over time they will make some great editions, and can live up to the Madam Tussauds museum I am accustomed to. The Wax museum did not have a scary section either...  My mom and I actually ended up walking through the museum backwards once we finished, because we were certain we must have missed a hall or something, but sadly we were wrong, the tour was just a lot smaller than any of the Madam Tussauds either one of us have previously visited  (NYC, LA and VEGAS).
On a positive note I appreciated that the SF attraction incorporated a lot SF culture- Silicon Tech magnates, as well as other well known bay area natives like Robin Williams, and of course Harvey Milk, and Hitchcock. 

In short I would have rather seen more A listers and less BillyJean Kings, whoopi goldbergs and Michael Phelps.( I included Michael Michael Phelps,because I actually witnessed him at a gold tournament being a poor sport, and denying little kids autographs just because he was temporarily sucking at life).


* PS I Would love to see tom Hanks and  James Franco here in the near future.



Oh & the Beatles section is missing the members.

No local discount given...
author: Ang G.

description:
Glad I received free tickets here because I don't think I would have paid full price for this place.

Madame Tussauds is a great place for taking pictures with well-known people and just a place to have a little fun with family and friends. Though, I was annoyed at the workers waiting with their cameras to take pictures for guests. Like, many of us are already taking FREE pictures with our phones and you want us to pay? Nah.

It got a bit tiring towards the end to the point where I was asking myself, geez, how many more wax figures to go?? I was sad James Dean wasn't there. :(

I liked Alfred Hitchcock's little spot next to Whoopi. I liked how you opened the curtains and the music from Psycho played. Oh, and there was a bloody knife dangling in there too.

Overall, it was a rather fun experience, but I don't think I would come again unless they bring James Dean. :)
author: Krystal C.

description:
So my daughter wanted to try the place associated with this the Dungeons of San Francisco... they gave us free tickets to Madame Tussauds. Who would pass up a free ticket? So we all headed there after lunch at Rain Forest Cafe... It was fun... multiple stories.. My daughter is 12 and she had fun taking pics... especially when they had readily available spots all over the place.

I do not think I would have paid for the experience... I don't think I was missing out on anything special... but for free? It was worth every penny
author: Jenn S.

description:
Disclaimer: I am related to an employee.

These wax figure are AMAZING!  I took a _very_ close look at many of them, and the incredible detail created such a life-like appearance that I expected them to move.  It would be so easy to spend a very long time appreciating each scene.

Go see The San Francisco Dungeon at the same time, and save some scratch.
author: Greg G.

description:
I loved this place! Very clean when entering, lots of fun as you can get up Close and personal with all the figures and each scene has props to interact with the figurines! 

My husband and I also did wax hand souvigniers and they were reasonably priced unlike the admission. 


Very clean, very fun, steep admission. Better deal with the combo to the dungeon and getting tickets beforehand. I will hit the dungeon next time for sure!!!
author: Opinionated B.

description: STupid Touristy but still loads of fun.  Those figures sure can be creepy!  You really expect any one of them to just turn and start talking to you!  Won't take you more than 30 minutes to spin through when not over crowded. If you are a local, online tix are half price.
author: Flynn L.

description: Came here after Dungeon since they had a promotion to do both for an extra $10.  Its basically a wax museum of current/past celebrities and iconic figures.  There's probably 20-30 statues.  Plus they let you take pictures up and close with the statues and have costumes you can try on.  Overall, its worth the $10, anymore and I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Mike M.

description: A rep from Merlin Entertainment contacted me almost immediately and apologized. Considering how few businesses respond in that manner, it was very nice. Even so, that would've only merited 2 or 3 stars. The important thing is that they updated the hours of operation on their website within days of the first review going up. Such quick correction from a somewhat large corporate entity deserves praise.
author: Johnathan Y.

description: I went (7/19/14) and had an awesome time! So glad you're now able to get up close and personal with the wax figures. Years ago this place was simply a wax museum that you could just look at the figures. Can't believe how life like they are. I took pictures with every figure they had to offer.
author: Kenya S.

description: We loved this place! I went with my 11 year old grand daughter. You are allowed to use the props and pose with the statues which look freakishly real! Be sure to take your camera. I had been to other wax museums and they were no where near this fun! The staff were very nice and very helpful. We had a great time. We also did the dungeon tour. You have to do this!! It was also a ton of fun. The people who play the characters are perfect for the parts. I loved the Judge, he was hilarious! I will be back, next time with my Hubby or another grandkid.
author: Vikki A.

description:
I bought a Groupon that was $31 for two people, regular price is $52.00.

The remodel is wonderful! The wax figure actually look like the celebrities now and they're set up ways to be interactive with them to take pictures. I loved all of the props that people are able to use to take personal photos with. 

There are stations where employees take your picture that you can buy at the very end. The pictures didn't turn out well and they're way over priced, but I can understand how it's another way for them to make money.

It's a lot smaller than it used to be, but it's much more interactive and fun. Enjoy.
author: Christina C.

description:
This is an awesome wax museum, it has various styled locations from horror to presidents, to historical figures ect...

The figures are VERY lifelike to the point of perhaps confusing you and permitting you to have a conversation with an inanimate object. The location is great as it's right in downtown SF and the little information blurbs they give about each "person" are also really cool.
author: Spencer G.

description: This place was very cool. My fiance' and I decided to check out this place along with the Ripley's believe it or not and the Wax museum. The inside where the wax figures were at were very cool and well decorative. This place is a fun attraction and a must see!
author: Makayla L.

description:
I've been to the wax museums in NYC and Montreal and always have a lot of fun checking them out. Many of the statues are incredibly realistic!! At this smaller wax museum in Fisherman's Wharf, I was amazed at the intricate detail of skin tones. Betty White and Harvey Milk were among my favorites! I also like how each wax museum has many city natives included in their exhibits. 
Sure, it's a touristy thing to do in SF, but a fun way to kill a few hours on our last day in the city. Great place to bring the kids as well. We paid $16/adult for admission.
author: Mariella Z.

description: I personally love all the Madame Tussauds I've been to and this is no different. I recommend it. Good place to take loads of pics
author: Ben R.

description: Smaller than most locations and the price is just as high.  Limited attractions lacking the usual appeal.  We would not return.
author: Pat W.

description: its a fun place to go maybe once to have fun. the wax figures are simply amazing in terms of likeness and quality. but its on the expensive side and there really isnt a whole lot to see. i went this weekend for the first time and spent about an hour and fifteen minutes there. while its really fun its just too expensive for such a short amount of time. use a coupon if you can, the airports have $8 coupons and if you go to the California Welcome Center at Pier 39, they have discount offers.
author: Steven C.

description: Great place to visit.  They had a lot of famous figures to take pictures with.  Luckily we bought the VIP pass (good at the dungeon as well).  By far, my favorite part was seeing how the figures were made.  We got to make a wax figure out of our hands.  Emily and Mayra were outstanding.  They made the experience so much fun.  Hats off to whom ever hired these two ladies!!!  Great experience.  I highly recommend you try this place.
author: Erik S.

description: I have been to the one in NY which was good.  This location is much smaller. They need to update their celebrities. It was nice but needs more figures.
author: Funtime P.

description:
Scored 2 tickets here because I'm a part time concierge at work so I decided to give this place a shot after work. It replaced the San Francisco Wax Museum and thank goodness it did... those wax figures looked fake as hell! I've been to the Madame Tussauds in Las Vegas yeaaaaars ago and I remember I had tons of fun.

The elevators to get in take forever!! -- we probably waited 5 minutes. But once you get in, you're in. Goodness... it's crazy how realistic these figures are. Plenty of times I would scare myself because I would think that from a first glance the wax figure was a real person when in all reality, it was just a wax figure. It was neat of them to start the museum off with San Francisco historic figures such as Ed Lee. Probably did learn some great things about the city. What is also fun is that they have plenty of props just laying around so there's plenty of photo ops! You also get to touch the wax figures as much as you like ;) You talk through the museum and all the wax figures are in different sceneries, based on categories. To name a few, there were San Francisco historical figures, Hollywood actors/actresses (Audrey Hepburn, Jennifer Aniston), famous celebrities, pop stars (Lady Gaga), artists (Madonna, The Beatles), American historic figures (Abe Lincoln, Obama, Rosa Parks, etc.), and more...

Overall, I had fun and the wax figures were super darn realistic. However, I must complain that it was super toasty in there and I started sweating. Probably from all the lighting? Or maybe I was getting nervous from being in the presence of such famous celebrities like Beyonce, Rihanna, Leonardo Da Vinci, etc.? 

Question is if I would recommend to others to drop $21 for admission -- maybe if the museum was slightly larger. But if you're bored in the city, have money to drop, and want a fun place to take a bunch of silly pictures, visit Madame Tussauds SF!
author: Cris-ann L.

description: This museum is awesome! They have the best wax statues period. This is awesome for all the family!! An awesome thing to do in fisherman a wharf!!!
author: Gary B.

description:
Just attended the Invitation Only Preview - was very impressed. UNBELIEVABLE details on each celebrity figure.

Staff is very well verse and very enthusiastic. It's got some great celebrity, historical, sports and entertainments personas figure to see. 

Great for the entire family and some interactive fun stuff.

Top Tier entertainment for the ENTIRE family. Great gift shop with some branded items that you can use again.
author: Liz D.

description: We loved it!!!   You can get as close as you want to the figures. My kids loved the lady gaga cause it had drums that they can play on.  I loved Michael Jackson too!!!  Oh of course Leonardo too!!!  The only thing we didn't care for was the staff taking the pictures by certain figures and then forcing us to buy them. That's my only complain. Great place and great wax figures!
author: Tina R.

description: At first I expected Madame Tussaud's to be a gimmicky place, it turns out I couldn't be more wrong. The wax figures have such immense detail and look so much like the actual celebrity it is unbelievable. It is really great that the figures are not behind glass or anything and you are allowed to touch them and take as many pictures as you want with them. The elevator going from floor to floor is quite large but they only allow six people at a time on it. At first we ought they were joking but it later seemed they were not.
author: Matt P.

description: I attended a preview of the museum before the 6/27 grand opening, and was pleasantly surprised.  There are a wide variety of wax figures and even though it's a bit cheesy, you do find yourself taking selfies with them!  in some cases, t's as close as you are going to get to meeting the real people.  there are political figures, tech figures, athletes, movie stars from a variety of eras/decades, music stars, and more.  Also nice backdrops of the city in some of the displays.  i would definitely bring visiting friends here as part of the Fisherman's wharf experience.
author: Bebe W.

description: I've been to a couple of other Madame Tussauds museums around the world (this is my first in the US) and this one seemed smaller by comparison. I don't know how much the regular tickets are, but we paid $10 per person as an upgrade from the San Francisco Dungeon tickets, so for that price it was reasonable. One of the things I do like in these museums is seeing the local flavour, so San Francisco includes some notable people who are part of the history here (like Harvey Milk, Alfred Hitchcock, Mark Zuckerberg, Steve Jobs, and one of the famous Alcatraz prisoners). I loved the E.T. figure in the bicycle, which was adorable for taking photos of my kids with, and as someone with a filmmaking background, I couldn't help getting a picture with the wax Steven Spielberg. The room with musicians/singers is a bit small, so it can be a bit harder to get pictures with some of them without another one in the background. Same with some of the actors. They have a decent range of personalities so you may not have heard of them all, but are probably likely to find at least one you're a fan of. Apart from Hitchcock, Spielberg, and E.T., my favourites included Audrey Hepburn from a Breakfast at Tiffany's scene, Whoopi Goldberg, Martin Luther King Jnr, Adele, Laverne Cox, Morgan Freeman, and Neil Patrick Harris. The Nicolas Cage figure is hilarious because his eyes look so dead/emotionless.
author: Dominica M.

description: I had such a good time here!  I like how you can get up close and personal with each figurine and touch them.  Most museums have the "do not touch" rule but as humans, we're a curious bunch.  What I especially liked the most was the fact that they provided props for the guests to use for pictures.  They even had photo stations where the museum would take professional pictures for you to purchase at the end of the tour.  For example, you can take pictures with the President, MJ, and etc... I really enjoyed my time at this museum and wished they had more!!
author: Ashley C.

description: We visited the place Thursday, May 26, 2016 in the afternoon.   It was fun, we took pictures!  Going out, they showed us our pictures and we decided to buy it ($32.63)  together with the album. We were given the code.  As soon as we got home, check the website and input the code provided us.  Unfortunately, it gave the message "code can not be found"! I tried the following day again and again, next day again and again, no luck!  We feel CHEATED!!!  I sent them message today and hopefully will hear from them.  Not recommending to anybody.  :( I am going to dispute the charges in my card, if I don't hear from them thru this weekend.  I made shoots of the message, so I could use to dispute the charges!!  :(  :(
author: Edna N.

description:
Very worthwhile attraction and wonderful addition to the legendary Fisherman's Wharf.  The wax figures are truly well-done and life-like.  Each theme in the attraction was well-thought out.  

One can tell how much effort and time is invested in each of the celebrity figures.  Guests are welcome to touch and take pictures which completes the experience.  Naturally there is expected wear and tear on a daily basis - incredibly each figure looks fresh and ready to entertain everyday!

Thanks so much for coming to San Francisco Madame Tussauds!!!
author: Chris D.

description: Our teenagers went by themselves with our 8 year and they had a great hour of fun. Dressing up, using props and posing with celebs was great fun.
author: April B.

description: Absolutely amazing work by the artists of Madame Tussauds' studio.  Kept waiting for Steve Jobs' figure to move.  Same for Mayor Ed Lee.  Entered as a skeptic; left as a believer.  The history of the business was also fascinating.
author: Suzanne H.

description:
This was a very fun time!  This wax museum is totally interactive, you can stand up next to the figures and pose with them, even touch them.  

The figures themselves are extremely life-like and not a little bit creepy.  But the posing for pictures part is great fun, some of the things people were doing were pretty funny to see.

It is well worth a visit, but it's very small.  Smaller than it should be.  They could probably lose the statue of Mayor Lee and Joseph Strauss and a couple others who no one would miss.  

Go very slowly, and enjoy each figure as much as possible, because the place ends before you realize.  It should be about twice as big as it currently is. 

As long as you understand this, it's really fun, though.  Got a ton of pictures.
author: Jon N.

description: Very fun and interactive! A big difference from the last time I'd been here in 2001! You get to take as many pictures as you want, you can touch the figures and take your time enjoying everything. We got the upgrade when we did the dungeons next door and it was worth it. Definitely a cool place to check out with a group of friends.
author: Renee P.

description: This place was pretty cool... not very busy on a Friday morning which was nice.  They allow you to get as close to and pose with the wax figures which makes it pretty fun for picture taking.  There are workers stationed around the displays to take pictures for you as well.
author: Brad S.

description:
This wax attraction is awesome!  The figures are so realistic that it made me want to talk to them.

I Highly recommend visiting this famous wax attraction where you will feel like your standing next to a real person instead of a wax figure!
author: Jerry H.

description: This place is so much better than the old wax museum. They removed the ropes and let you now get right up next to them for pictures. They could include tv's next to the figures showing their best moments while they were alive/at their best. For example some of Michael Jackson, lady gaga, and Rihanna music videos, footage of muhammad ali's fights, babe Ruth hitting home runs, etc. Also they used to have movie scenes like the wizard of oz characters skipping down the yellow brick road, Jack and rose of titanic on the bow of the ship, all with background music from the actual movies. Would have been nice to see some movie scenes, but we did love how it's interactive now so you can pose with them in various scenes! All in all a COMPLETE upgrade but still could engage the audience a little more.
author: Megan V.

description: This wax museum is by far the best wax museum I have ever been too! The wax people look super real! It was fun to interact, touch, and take pictures with the wax people! The entertainment was awesome! The dungeon section next store was also very fun. It wasn't too scary, more entertaining if anything however, I wouldn't recommend it for kids under 13. The only reason why I give this place a four stars instead of 5 is because the workers there are too pushy with sales. They almost wouldn't take no for an answer with buying pictures and souvenirs. It was very uncomfortable when they wouldn't let u give them back the pictures they took of you, or put items in your face and tell you, you have to buy it. If someone doesn't want to buy something or can't afford it then they shouldn't be so pushy. Other wise this place is great!
author: Rachel W.

description: first I thought this place was going to be boring and a waste of money and time but it was actually really fun a little bit on the expense side 26 per person I also felt rushed by the camera man even tho at that moment it was just my family and I. Hopefully in the future they get more stars that would be really great. But if you happen to be in sf give it a try
author: Vanessa H.

description: This is the second Madame Tussauds that I've been to this year, also going to the one in Hollywood earlier. The figures are extremely impressive and are posed in such a way that it's fun to take pictures with them.
author: David C.

description: This was so much fun. I can't begin to explain how thrilling it was to be that close to people I only read about. The workmanship is mind-boggeling in that most of them look so real. Tupac even had scars! I love Johnny Depp and this man looked so real I half expected him to turn and look at me to tell me to stop breathing down his neck! You've GOT to see this show. You will not be disappointed. I wasn't.
author: Valeri P.

description: I had complimentary tickets so I had to come before they expires. I had fun taking funny pictures with my cousins. It was my first time going to these wax museums and I expected it a lot bigger inside. They only had 2 floors but we spent a good hour there. And we got in for free!
author: Amy Z.

description:
Lots of fun
My daughters14th birthday with 6 friends had a great time
Interacting with the wax figures 
And taking lots of selfies
author: Jim B.

description: We've been to several of the other locations, Las Vegas and New York, and wanted to see the new Jimmy Fallon, and we were not disappointed...  The replicas are very lifelike...  Morgan Freeman was amazing, as were Tony Bennett, Lincoln, MLK, President Obama, the Beatles, Michael Jackson, and Lady Gaga.... We will definitely be back, and will bring friends, neighbors, and family...
author: CDR JAY C. O.

description: Best wax museum ever!!! U can touch them and take a ton of pictures! They let you dip your hand in wax and they will give you a wax hand! Soo awesome. Staff was very nice.
author: Cole F.

description: The wax figures looked so real, I was saying hi to them like they were really there!! Definitely worth the money! There are 3 floors of wax figures! From celebrities, to legends, and even sports. The props that they offered for you to use with the wax figures was a lot of fun!
author: Katrina M.

description: My husband and I recently took our two 16 yr. old grandson's to Madame Tussauds Wax Museum at Fisherman's Wharf.  It has changed dramatically and now has such life like wax figures that I thought several of them would get up and walk around.  The workmanship was superb and so was the lay out of the Museum itself.  They also had opportunities for group pictures with certain displays as well as interactive booths for the kids.  You can also bring your camera and take your own pictures.  They have costumes you can use and you are allowed to gently touch the figures.  Sometimes you had to because they looked so real.  We all had a wonderful time and we felt it is one of the best things we have visited in SF.  I highly recommend you visit but I suggest you go in the morning so it isn't crowded.  It is great entertainment for the whole family at a reasonable price.
author: Pat L.

description: So glad they shut down the old wax museum and reopened as a REAL wax museum.  Now it is up to par with others in different states.  The figures are soooo real that it's creepy.  Wish they had even more figures.  Maybe they will expand.  Certainly worth checking out even if you live in the bay.
author: J J.
